text: (bright music)
- Today, data and machine learning
are accelerating innovation
in virtually all industries and sectors.

From Olympic gold medals
to advances in medicine,
organizations are using machine learning
to push the frontiers of what's possible.
Take the Australian Olympic swimming team,

the coaches knew that they
had a treasure trove of data

on the swimmers, but they
didn't know the best way
to use it to advance the training.

Once they could really
use and apply this data

at the poolside, the
positive results were clear

on the biggest world stage
for sports, the Olympics.

it's the ultimate goal, it's

In Australia, we're a water-loving nation.

There's a saying that

and every aspect matters,

physiological data,
performance training data.

in reams of paper.

There'd be numbers everywhere,
and a lot of times,
it just went into the wastebasket.

- Whether it's measuring race
times or election results,
machine learning can create efficiencies.
At Broadridge, where hundreds of millions

of shareholder votes
are counted every year,
they have bottlenecks with reviewing

and extracting information
from these votes at scale.

- The core business we
have is proxy voting.
A lot of people care greatly

about environmental
social governance issues,

about board diversity,
and through proxy voting,
you can enact real change in the companies
that you own shares in.

And in 2020, over 150
million Americans voted
in the presidential election.
What a lot of people don't know

is that the proxy voting process
is many, many times larger.
In the last 12 months, we distributed

over 400 million
communications to shareholders.
It's a huge amount of data.

This was a natural
project to think about AWS

and their advanced machine
learning capabilities.
I remember the kickoff

with Amazon Machine
Learning Solutions Lab,

looking around the table
and just being amazed
at the talent, at the advanced degrees.
They listened and they took the time
to understand our unique needs.

Fast forward a few months,
and we put a algorithm

and all the ML ops around
it into production,

that has allowed us to cope
with the massive volume
of the data and the seasonality spikes

and it's created efficiencies
of about 30% cost savings,

and something that I'm really
proud of that we've done

together with the Amazon
Machine Learning Solutions Lab

through this project is
provide a lot of data
that helps inform shareholders

to better make change
happen in this world.

- Now more than ever, we
need medical breakthroughs,
and we need them quickly,

but human trial and error
can take valuable time

and might miss key insights
into what makes safe,
effective, and transformational therapies.
In their partnership
with the Machine Learning Solutions Lab,

Janssen was able to
harness the power of data
to serve patients faster and better.
(ethereal music)

- For me, it's always
been about the patients.
I grew up on three continents, you know,

by the time I was 18,
and I've seen the impact

on human health from the
most developed country
to the most developing country.
And I think there's a lot we can do

to level the playing field
in terms of healthcare
and the impact for patients.

The combination of data
science and science

is really advancing
how we can help humans.

In order to develop a
medicine, it takes us years,

but I think there's so much
opportunity using data science,

AI, machine learning, to
not just shave the time,

that's one aspect, but I think
the more important aspect
is insight that lets you know early on
that something's not gonna be toxic,

that something is gonna have
a better safety profile,

that something truly
can be transformational.
And this led us

to the Amazon Machine
Learning Solutions Lab.

Using some of the differentiated
capabilities AWS has

from a data integration
perspective, and then coupling that

with our know-how on chemistry
data, on biological data,
adding a powerful search engine,
and then applying AI and machine learning

to be able to predict
which of these molecules

would have the best chance
of being a medicine.
With the open-mindedness and creativeness

of using data science,
we're in the best position
in the central point to help patients.

That's what gets me out
of bed every morning.
